events.message: The insured reported a collision involving their vehicle with another car at an intersection. Initial details of the accident were provided.
Based on the nature of the incident, the claim was categorised under Auto Accident as it involves motor vehicle collision.
An insurance agent, John Smith, was assigned to handle this vehicle collision claim for further processing and support.
Claimant received official acknowledgment of their auto accident claim submission along with next steps to provide necessary documentation.
The insurer requested photos of the damaged vehicle, police report, and repair estimates to proceed with the investigation of the accident.
The claimant submitted all requested documents including police report, vehicle damage photos, and preliminary repair quotes.
The claims investigation team began reviewing all submitted materials and started assessments to verify details of the accident.
Investigation concluded confirming fault determination and extent of vehicle damage consistent with the collision report.
A settlement offer was proposed to the claimant covering the repair costs and rental vehicle expenses incurred due to the accident.
The claimant expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and responsiveness of the claims handling process.
Based on the investigation and claimant agreement, the claim was formally approved to proceed to payment issuance.
The settlement payment for damages and additional expenses related to the vehicle collision was successfully transferred to claimant.
Following payment issuance and claimant confirmation of receipt, the auto accident claim was officially closed in the system.
All relevant documents and data related to this vehicle collision claim were securely archived for future reference.
